class.name: Ant
class.brief: The main object of interest of any Experiment
class.doc:
Ant are the object of interest of an fort::myrmidon::Experiment.
## Naming
Ant are uniquely identified by AntID. By convention we use hexadecimal to display an ID, as returned by FormattedID.
## Identification
Instead of working directly with fort::myrmidon::TagID myrmidon uses fort::myrmidon::Identification to relates fort::myrmidon::TagID to an Ant. An Ant could have different fort::myrmidon::Identification, allowing us to use different fort::myrmidon::TagID to refer to the same individual. Myrmidon ensures the following invariant:
* At any fort::myrmidon::Time there is only a single fort::myrmidon::TagID used to designate an Ant * For any Ant, there only a single fort::myrmidon::Identification that designate this Ant at any given fort::myrmidon::Time. I.e. fort::myrmidon::Identification::Start and fort::myrmidon::Identification::End must not overlap for a given Ant.
One would use IdentifiedAt to obtain the fort::myrmidon::TagID that identifies an Ant at a given fort::myrmidon::Time.
## Visualization property
Visualization of fort::myrmidon::Experiment data is done through fort-studio. Ants are visualized according to their DisplayStatus and DisplayColor, which can be programmaticaly modified using SetDisplayStatus and SetDisplayColor. Ants are showed according to DisplayState value.
## Non-tracking data (named values)
Ant also stores timed non-tracking data, called named_values. These are modifiable using SetValue and DeleteValue and accesible through GetValue.
## Ant Shapping
Each Ant has a virtual shape that can be modified with AddCapsule and DeleteCapsule.
More complete informations can be found in ant_interaction

enum.name: DisplayState
enum.brief: The DisplayState of an Ant in an Experiment

enumvalue.name: SOLO
enumvalue.brief: Ant is visible and all non-soloed ant will be hidden.

typedef.name: ID
typedef.doc: ID are unique within an Experiment.

constructor.name: Ant
constructor.doc: User cannot build Ant directly. They must be build and accessed from fort::myrmidon::Experiment.

method.name: AddCapsule
method.brief: Adds a Capsule to the Ant virtual shape
method.doc:
Adds a fort::myrmidon::Capsule to the Ant virtual shape, associated with the fort::myrmidon::AntShapeTypeID body part.
R Version : ```R ant$addCapsule(shapeTypeID,fmCapsuleCreate(c(x1,y1),c(x2,y2),r1,r2)) ```

method.name: AntID
method.brief: Gets the ID of an Ant
method.doc:
Ants gets an unique ID in an experiment.
R Version : ```R ant$antID() ```

method.name: Capsules
method.brief: Gets all part of this ant

return.doc: a fort::myrmidon::TypedCapsuleList representing the virtual shape of the Ant

method.name: CIdentifications
method.brief: Gets the const Identifications for this Ant
method.doc:
Gets the fort::myrmidon::Identification targetting this Ant. These fort::myrmidon::Identification will always be sorted in fort::myrmidon::Time and not overlapping.
R Version : ```R ant$cIdentifications() ```

method.name: DeleteCapsule
method.brief: Delete a part of the virtual shape
method.doc: R Version : ```R # ATTENTION, index are still starting from 0 ant$deleteCapsule(index) ```

argument.name: index
argument.doc: the index in the fort::myrmidon::Ant::Capsules to remove

method.name: DeleteValue
method.brief: Removes any value defined for a time
method.doc:
Removes any value defined at a fort::myrmidon::Time.
R Version : ```R time <- fmTimeParse("XXXX")$const_ptr() # could also be fmTimeInf() ant$deleteValue(name,time) ```

method.name: DisplayColor
method.brief: Gets the Display Color of an Ant
method.doc:
Each Ant has a defined color for display.
R Version : ```R ant$displayColor() ```

return.doc: a const reference to the fort::myrmidon::Color used to display the Ant

method.name: DisplayStatus
method.doc:
When interacting with the FORT Studio, any Ant has different fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState :
* fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState::VISIBLE: the Ant is visible if they are no Ant which are fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState::SOLO * fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState::HIDDEN: the Ant is not displayed * fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState::SOLO: the Ant is visible and all non fort::myrmidon::Ant::DisplayState::SOLO Ant are shown
R Version : ```R s <- ant$displayStatus() # to get the name of the value names(which( s == fmAntDisplayState ) ) ```

method.name: FormattedID
method.brief: Gets the ID of the Ant formatted as a string.
method.doc:
By Convention fort::myrmidon::Ant::ID are formatted using hexadecimal notation (as opposed to tag that are formatted decimal).
R Version : ```R ant$formattedID() ```

return.doc: a string with the formatted ID

method.name: GetValue
method.doc:
Gets the value for name at time. Values are set with fort::myrmidon::Ant::SetValue. If no value is sets prior to time (including -âˆž), it will be using the fort::myrmidon::Experiment default one.
R Version : ```R ant$getValue(name,time) ```

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the non-tracking data value

argument.name: time
argument.doc: the fort::myrmidon::Time we want the value for

method.name: Identifications
method.brief: Gets the Identifications for this Ant
method.doc:
Gets the fort::myrmidon::Identification targetting this Ant. These fort::myrmidon::Identification will always be sorted in fort::myrmidon::Time and not overlapping.
R Version : ```R ant$identifications() ```

return.doc: an fort::myrmidon::Identification::List copy of all fort::myrmidon::Identification

method.name: IdentifiedAt
method.brief: Gets the TagID identifying this Ant at a given time.
method.doc: Gets the fort::myrmidon::TagID identifying this Ant at a given. There may not have an identification at this given time, an an exception will be thrown. R version: ```R ant$identifiedBy(fmTimeParse("2020-02-19T15:14:00.000Z")) ```

return.doc: a fort::myrmidon::TagID that identify this ant at this time if it exists (throw an exception otherwise)

method.name: SetValue
method.brief: Sets a non-tracking data value at given Time
method.doc:
Sets name to value starting from time. If time is nullptr, sets the starting value for name. fort::myrmidon::Ant::GetValue is always defined even if user does not define value for nullptr time has the fort::myrmidon::Experiment default value will be used.
R Version : ```R time <- fmTimeParse("XXXX")$const_ptr() # could also be fmTimeInf() ant$setValue(name,value,time) ```

argument.name: time
argument.doc: the first fort::myrmidon::Time after which name will be set to value
